heading: Time to Hack! Happy Hacking!
body: This login text field is the only place accepting alphanumeric characters in my blog, which means this is one of the most vulnerable point of the whole system! So Scary!

According to Kerckhoffs's principle: 'A cryptosystem should be secure even if everything about the system, except the key, is public knowledge' and also Shannon's maxim: 'the enemy will immediately gain full familiarity with the systems', open design is better than security through obscurity in order to prevent attacks.

I have already shared the system architecture on home page, as this blog is a composition of open source projects in my Github. You are welcome to hack this blog, just treat this as a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition.

If you successfully hack my blog, you will see some private contents. You can use whatever methods you like to get the secret as long as you are following AWS Penetration Testing Guidance. If you find any vulnerability, please let me know.
Let's explore and enhance hacking skills through endless real-world battles!
